versions.title: Aggregation Method
versions.definition: Identifies the type of aggregation used to combine related categories, usually within a common branch of a hierarchy, to provide information at a broader level than the level at which detailed observations are taken. (From: The OECD Glossary of Statistical Terms)
versions.notes: This vocabulary was first published by the DDI Alliance. Please see: https://ddialliance.org/controlled-vocabularies/all.
versions.versionNotes: 1. ArithmeticMean, CumulativePercent, PercentileRank: Descriptive term capitalization changed to make them conform to the other vocabularies. 2. Count, Mode: Period added at the end of the code definitions to make them conform to the other vocabularies.
versions.versionChanges:
Code descriptive term rephrased: Arithmetic Mean rephrased into Arithmetic mean
Code descriptive term rephrased: Cumulative Percent rephrased into Cumulative percent
Code descriptive term rephrased: Percentile Rank rephrased into Percentile rank
Code definition rephrased: Count
Code definition rephrased: Mode
versions.citation: DDI Alliance. (2019). Aggregation Method (Version 1.1) [Controlled vocabulary]. CESSDA. urn:ddi:int.ddi.cv:AggregationMethod:1.1.
versions.ddiUsage:
DDI 3.2
Module name:     reusable
Element name:    AggregationMethod

DDI 2.5
Element/Attribute name: var@otherAggrMeth

Element/Attribute name: measure@otherAggrMeth

concepts.title: Percent
concepts.definition: The number of parts out of 100. In mathematics, a percentage is a number of ratio expressed as a fraction of 100. Percentages are used to express how large one quantity is relative to another quantity.

concepts.title: Percentile rank
concepts.definition: The percentile rank of a item is the percentage of items in its frequency distribution which are lower [cannot reach 100%].

concepts.title: Sum
concepts.definition: A value obtained as a result of adding two or more numbers (items/amounts).

concepts.title: Cumulative percent
concepts.definition: The total of a frequency and all frequencies below it in a frequency distribution; the "running total" of frequencies [the maximum value is 100%].

concepts.title: Arithmetic mean
concepts.definition: Mathematical average of a set of values. The mean is calculated by adding up two or more values and dividing the total by their number. In social/political science, it is usually the sum of the measurements divided by the number of subjects, or cases.

concepts.title: Other
concepts.definition: Use when the aggregation method is known, but not found in the list.

concepts.title: Minimum
concepts.definition: The lowest value attained or recorded.

concepts.title: Count
concepts.definition: Total number of units in a group of items.

concepts.title: Maximum
concepts.definition: The highest value attained or recorded.

concepts.title: Median
concepts.definition: The middle value in a series of values arranged sequentially from smallest to largest.

concepts.title: Mode
concepts.definition: The value that appears most often in a set of values.

versionHistories.note: This vocabulary was first published by the DDI Alliance. Please see: https://ddialliance.org/controlled-vocabularies/all.

versions.title: Aggregeringsmetode
versions.definition: Identificerer den type aggregering, der anvendes til at kombinere relaterede kategorier, normalt inden for en fælles gren af et hierarki, til at tilvejebringe information på et bredere niveau end det, på hvilket detaljerede observationer er foretaget. (Fra: OECD-ordlisten med statistiske begreber)
versions.citation: DDI Alliance. (2020). Aggregeringsmetode [Aggregation Method] (Version 1.1.1; The Danish National Archives, Transl.) [Controlled vocabulary]. CESSDA. urn:ddi:int.ddi.cv:AggregationMethod:1.1.
versions.ddiUsage:
DDI 3.2
Module name:     reusable
Element name:    AggregationMethod

DDI 2.5
Element/Attribute name: var@otherAggrMeth

Element/Attribute name: measure@otherAggrMeth

concepts.title: Sum
concepts.definition: En værdi opnået som et resultat af tilføjelse af to eller flere tal (elementer/mængder).

concepts.title: Aritmetisk gennemsnit
concepts.definition: Matematisk gennemsnit af et sæt af værdier. Gennemsnittet beregnes ved at tilføje to eller flere værdier og dividere totalen med deres antal. I social/politisk videnskab er det som regel summen af målingerne divideret med antallet af subjekter eller cases.

concepts.title: Antal
concepts.definition: Samlet antal af enheder i en gruppe af elementer.

concepts.title: Modus
concepts.definition: Den værdi, der oftest forekommer i et sæt af værdier.

concepts.title: Median
concepts.definition: Den midterste værdi i en serie af værdier arrangeret i rækkefølge fra mindst til størst.

concepts.title: Maksimum
concepts.definition: Den højest opnåede eller registrerede værdi.

concepts.title: Minimum
concepts.definition: Den lavest opnåede eller registrerede værdi.

concepts.title: Procent
concepts.definition: Antallet af dele ud af 100. I matematik er en procentdel et forholdstal udtrykt som en brøkdel af 100. Procentdele anvendes til at udtrykke, hvor stor en mængde er i forhold til en anden.

concepts.title: Kumulativ procent
concepts.definition: Summen af en frekvens og alle frekvenser under den i en frekvensfordeling; den ”løbende sum” af frekvenser [den maksimale værdi er 100%].

concepts.title: Procentdel rang
concepts.definition: Den procentdele rang af et element er procentdelen af elementer i dens frekvensfordeling, der er lavere [kan ikke nå 100%].

concepts.title: Andet
concepts.definition: Anvend, når aggregeringsmetoden er kendt, men ikke findes i listen.
